forecast.name: Today
forecast.shortForecast: Rain Showers Likely then Mostly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers likely before 11am. Mostly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. West southwest wind around 10 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Partly Cloudy then Chance Rain Showers
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers after 1am. Partly cloudy, with a low around 48. South southwest wind 5 to 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
A veil of dampness lingers in Downtown San Francisco, where the morning unfolded under a curtain of rain showers, the last of which are gradually dissipating, making way for a delicate grace of sunshine to emerge. The air feels crisp, a gentle reminder of the coolness that accompanies this time of year, with temperatures drifting towards a high of fifty-eight, then retreating slightly as the day wanes. With a wind whispering softly from the west-southwest and the promise of more rain teasing the night ahead, the atmosphere balances between refreshing and slightly edgy, as if the city itself is caught in a dance with the clouds.

The horizon holds the promise of fleeting sunlit moments, while tendrils of fog may still snake around the fringes of the Golden Gate, obscuring the view of the expansive bay. As the day dips toward evening, consider dressing warmly—a sturdy jacket will suffice against the cool winds and possible rain, complemented with comfortable shoes suitable for a gentle stroll along the waterfront. Perhaps visiting an intriguing local café for a warm beverage may be the perfect way to enjoy this temperate day, allowing the lingering rain to fade into an afterthought as you sip and watch the world meander by.
